description.description_en: Deciduous trees, 20 m tall, 40 cm across; branchlets glabrous or slightly pubescent when young.Leaves alternate, elliptic, oblong to ovate-oblong, 6–12 cm long, 2–5 cm wide, acuminate at apex, broadly cuneate at base, glabrous or slightly pubescent when young, serrulate, lateral veins 6–7 pairs, midrib prominent beneath; petioles slender, 1.5–2.5 cm long.Staminate catkins at apex of branchlets, pendulous; bracts rhombic-rounded, each subtending 3 flowers; pistillate spikes at apex of old branchlets; bracts 3–4 mm long, woody, apex rounded, 5-lobed, each bract subtending 2 flowers; ovary 2-celled, each cell with 1 ovule; styles 2.Fruiting catkins 1–3 together, peduncled, about 1.5 cm long, cone-like, ellipsoid, persistent;nutlets compressed, with narrow wings, persistent, style remaining at the top.
